item.title: Using Data to Drive Business Growth
item.dc:creator: Nina
item.description:
Learn how data and analytics can help businesses gain insight into how consumers engage with them online. We’ll offer tips for using Google Analytics to analyze customer trends and provide best practices for turning these insights into well-informed, actionable decisions. *This event is organized and hosted by a Grow with Google Program Partner

item.title: Hotspot and I-Corp Program Briefings
item.dc:creator: Nina
item.description:
Date & Time:Monday, September 23rd, 201912:00-1:30 PM EDT Location:Tech Incubator at Queens College65-30 Kissena Blvd, CEP Hall 2Flushing, NY 11367 Come and learn about Hotspot and I-Corp program and see how your startup or your startup ideas can benefit from them Arber Ruci, Director, New York City Innovation Hot Spot and Entrepreneur-in-Residence, NYCRIN and his colleagues from […]

The post Hotspot and I-Corp Program Briefings appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.
item.content:encoded:
Date & Time:
Monday, September 23rd, 2019
12:00-1:30 PM EDT

Location:
Tech Incubator at Queens College
65-30 Kissena Blvd, CEP Hall 2
Flushing, NY 11367

Come and learn about Hotspot and I-Corp program and see how your startup or your startup ideas can benefit from them

Arber Ruci, Director, New York City Innovation Hot Spot and Entrepreneur-in-Residence, NYCRIN and his colleagues from CUNY I-Corps will come to the Tech Incubator and discuss the New York City Innovation Hot Spot program and how startups can benefit from this program. They will also provide an overview of the I-Corps program which introduces lean startup methodology and business model canvas to help entrepreneurs define their value proposition, find product market fit, prototype and test their MVPs and find the best business model that works for them.

Register for this event

The post Hotspot and I-Corp Program Briefings appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.

The post Website Launch! appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.
item.content:encoded:
Congratulations to SyncIoT who have officially launched the website and social media pages for their IoT sensors and energy management software!

SyncIoT Technologies is an IoT startup based in New York. We provide the best intelligent IoT sensors and energy management software to help reduce the cost of energy consumption. 

Check out their links below 

Website – https://synciot.io/
Facebook – https://www.facebook.com/synciot/
LinkedIn – https://www.linkedin.com/company/15848077/

The post Website Launch! appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.

item.title: Website Design and Build
item.dc:creator: Nina
item.description:
This is an introductory class for anyone interested in learning html, css and JavaScriot to build well-designed and functional websites. Topics Introduction to the Web and Web Development Fundamentals of HTML Fundamentals of CSS Introduction to JavaScript Personal Project – Student Portfolio

The post Website Design and Build appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.
item.content:encoded:
This is an introductory class for anyone interested in learning html, css and JavaScriot to build well-designed and functional websites.

Topics

  1. Introduction to the Web and Web Development
  2. Fundamentals of HTML
  3. Fundamentals of CSS
  4. Introduction to JavaScript
  5. Personal Project – Student Portfolio

The post Website Design and Build appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.

item.title: Tech Open House for Middle and High School Students
item.dc:creator: Nina
item.description:
Come and participate in a variety of tech related classes and activites at the Tech Incubator at Queens College. Learn what virtual reality is and what you can do with it. Learn the basics of 3D Modeling and 3D Printing. Learn Website Design and Build. Learn what Raspberry Pi is and what it can do. […]

The post Tech Open House for Middle and High School Students appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.
item.content:encoded:
Come and participate in a variety of tech related classes and activites at the Tech Incubator at Queens College.

  • Learn what virtual reality is and what you can do with it.
  • Learn the basics of 3D Modeling and 3D Printing.
  • Learn Website Design and Build.
  • Learn what Raspberry Pi is and what it can do.
  • Learn to code music using Sonic Pi

Meet college students and learn more about their college life and fun things they do.

Register for this Event

The post Tech Open House for Middle and High School Students appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.

item.title: Design Your Learning
item.dc:creator: Nina
item.description:
Design Your Learning” is based on a “ Designing Your Life ” class offered at the Stanford University taught by Dave Evans and Bill Burnett. This class is open to all students and to the general public, offered by the Tech Incubator at Queens College (TIQC). This class will focus on: Foundational or core skills, […]

The post Design Your Learning appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.
item.content:encoded:
Design Your Learning” is based on a “ Designing Your Life ” class offered at the Stanford University taught by Dave Evans and Bill Burnett.

This class is open to all students and to the general public, offered by the Tech Incubator at Queens College (TIQC).

This class will focus on:

  • Foundational or core skills, including confidence building, communication, learning how to learn, learning to use a set of tools for reframing questions, generating ideas, prototyping experience, decision making and taking actions
  • Self-Directed Learning and Time Management
  • General career readiness, including a set of tools for job search and networking

We will introduce a specific set of tools to you that will enable you to

  • Think about your learning view, your work view, and your life view
  • Find a balance along five dimensions: Work (Study), Love (Social, Relationship), Learning, Play, and Health. Set priorities and cultivate atomic habits to make progress towards your goals.
  • Come up with alternative plans for your future
  • Prototype conversations and experiences for your plan
  • Learn to reframe questions, make choices, make decisions, take actions and tell stories

Dates: 7/8, 7/10, 7/15, 7/17

Time: 6:30 pm to 8:30 pm

Location

Tech Incubator at Queens College

65-30 Kissena Blvd

CEP Hall 2

Queens, NY 11367

The post Design Your Learning appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.

item.title: Introduction to Visual Storytelling
item.dc:creator: Nina
item.description:
Whether you are a student, a working professional, or a business owner, the ability to tell your story will help you communicate your vision, build your brand, and distinguish yourself from the competition. Stories told visually, i.e., through photography, video, or film are powerful means to get your ideas across quickly and emotionally. In this […]

The post Introduction to Visual Storytelling appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.
item.content:encoded:
Whether you are a student, a working professional, or a business owner, the ability to tell your story will help you communicate your vision, build your brand, and distinguish yourself from the competition. Stories told visually, i.e., through photography, video, or film are powerful means to get your ideas across quickly and emotionally.

In this 3 day workshop, you will learn the general language of cinema by examining cinematography, screenwriting, production design and editing.

By the end of this class, the students will be able to:

  • Analyze a film and be able to go out and create your own visual story.
  • Understand the basics of visual storytelling and screenwriting, i.e. narrative structure, plot, theme, tone, etc.
  • Learn the language necessary to speak about filmmaking, i.e pre-production, production, and post-production.
  • Be ready to write and develop your own screenplay.

Register Here

The post Introduction to Visual Storytelling appeared first on Tech Incubator at Queens College.
